intro: Senecio dodrans, commonly known as the Dodrands' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in a head. Senecio dodrans is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
